intro: Pseudagrostistachys africana subsp. africana, commonly known as the African grass, is a perennial grass species native to southern Africa. It typically grows in open grasslands and rocky outcrops, thriving in well-drained soils. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid conditions, making it resilient to drought. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a potential candidate for ecological restoration projects.
